answers.text:
Hi Jenifer, 
Here are a few articles about predictive crime analytics that members have contributed to ICMA. I hope these articles help you with your report! 
•   “Big Data” Promises a Revolution- This is a great article that shows what some cities are doing with regards to big data and crime analytics. http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9506/public/pmplus1.cfm?title=%E2%80%9CBig%20Data%E2%80%9D%20Promises%20a%20Revolution&subtitle=&author=Bruce%20McClendon%20and%20Wally%20Hill
•   “Law Enforcement Analytics” is a great article posted by Chief Rodney Monroe of the City of Richmond that discusses their effort to measure crime in their city and the software they have been using along with some results and what they have learned in the process. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/20949
If anyone else could chime in on this question it would be of great help! 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: Thomas Wieczorek
answers.text:
Hi Jennifer,
You might want to look at research and the first papers produced by the "Smart Policing Initiative" (SPI). The program is operated by the Bureau of Justice (BJA), CNA and involves more than 30 law enforcement agencies. 
The program is broken into several groups and I am familiar with some of the work produced by Philadelphia which was presented at a recent Esri User Conference in San Diego.  Los Angeles has also been involved and reported good success. I believe on the CNA link through the SPI website you can download the first reports being produced.

author: Jenifer Della Valle
text: I am a graduate student at the University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill doing a project this semester on crime forecasting. I'm specifically wanting to learn how municipalities are evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of their predictive analytics software. Any examples or suggestions are helpful!
title: Predictive Crime Analytics
